instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message:
Hello again,

an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that does not charge the battery. There was corrosion on pins 22 23 24 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. Also, a burnt trace from pin 23 to <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>. I removed the ISL, cleaned up the area, put a new ISL in, put a wire from pin 23 to <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>. It still sees but does not charge the battery. Resistance 17/18 is 4.3Ohm and 27/28 20.8Ohm.

Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message: Battery looks good. I got it at 65% capacity. Load cycles are at 921. As I am doing the tests with the charger plugged in, it slowly discharges and is at 33% now. It boots off the battery just fine. I have no other known good battery to test, though...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message: Try another battery and MagSafe board just to be safe. What is your voltage on PPBUS?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message:
unfortunately I have no other battery to test. I changed the MagSafe board and

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> measured on <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>:

charger and battery:  fluctuates between 12.50 and 14.50 or so within a second
charger only:             15.39V
battery only:               10.92V

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message: 15.39 is way too high for PPBUS. Sounds like a shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>. Replace the ISL, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> all at the same time and see what happens.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message: So I took another MacBook apart and put this logic board in. Same thing, it does not charge a known good battery. Will change these three chips you are proposing and get back to you tomorrow.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message: I changed ISL with new one, took <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> from Aliexpress doner board, and now I get an on/off green light flashing every other second. Fan is spinning. I took another pair of  <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> from a known good board, same green light flashing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not charge battery
threads.message: And after changing the ISL another time, it worked! Battery is charging beautifully! You can close this case. Thank you all for your help.
